newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy's Dini says no plan to delay EMU entry.
newsitem.headline: Italy's Dini says no plan to delay EMU entry.

text.p: Foreign Minister Lamberto Dini on Wednesday excluded that there was a plan to delay EMU entry by Italy and other Mediterranean nations.
"I absolutely exclude that there is a plan that aims to put Italy and other Mediteranean countries on the sidelines. I exclude it completely," he said.
Dini was responding to reporters' questions about a newspaper report that Italy could be offered a deal to delay its entry to the single currency.

"These are just inferences. As we have said and heads of other governments have said, it will be meeting the criteria and not journalistic chit chat that will decide who enters Europe," Dini, a former treasury minister and central banker said.
Asked if he was confident that Italy would meet the criteria, Dini said: "We are making the greatest effort. I think we will be there along with the others. This is the goal and we have to reach it."
